Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fibrin Glue Sealant in Liver Resection

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to either fibrin glue application or control groups

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to either fibrin glue application or control groups

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the amount of blood loss, measured intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 150 patients were randomised to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were observed in transfusion requirements (0.15 ± 0.66 vs. 0.17 ± 0.63 PRCU; P = 0.7234)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
